page.title: 05Homelife Food
page.content: Mr and Mrs Cook have three children and live in Mudeford.They have a garden,a greenhouse and an allotment. They grow 90% of their vegetable requirements on the allotment and salad crops in the garden.Vegetables are eaten fresh but most are frozen for use during the year. Mrs Cook makes 70lbs of jam each year and 30lbs of pickles and chutney.The Cooks shop once a week at the Cooperative Supermarket in Christ- church buying dairy produce for the fridge and dried and tinned food.They also buy bread and cleaning materials. Every 3 months they buy 20lbs of assorted meat, poultry and offal at a freezer centre and 6lbs of fresh fish locally.All this is stored in the freezer.Milk is delivered daily. They use 28pints a week.
